physical_appearance: The image shows a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular and it features a man. He is dressed in his ethnic costume and carrying a parasol. He is looking towards the direction where the photograph was captured. He is holding onto an object in his left hand as well.
sgcool_label_text:
This photograph shows a man dressed in sarong kebaya and with a parasol in his hand. 

Studios were already established across the Strait Settlements and the Dutch East Indies by the 1840s and became increasingly prevalent in the 1850s. During the 1920s, Chinese-owned studios dominated the studio photography trade in Southeast Asia.
title_text: Photograph of a man in sarong kebaya with a parasol
subject_terms_1: studio portraits men (male humans) Peranakan folk costume
subject_terms_2: Black-and-white photography Portrait photography Men Ethnic costume
